title: Lungleiah Kangmei Ven Chawlhkar 2026 hawn a ni
content:
4356/2025-2026

Lunglei, 2026 Ramtuk thla ni 9:Vawiin khan Lunglei District Level Committee on Fire Prevention (DLCFP) huaihawtin Kangmei Ven Chawlhkar (Fire Prevention Week) 2026 hawnna hun chu Lunglei Convention Centre-ah hman a ni a. Lunglei District Superintendent of Police Pu J. Lalmuankima chu Khuallian a ni.

Khuallian Pu J. Lalmuankima chuan India leh khawvel ram hrang hrangte'n ramngaw ṭha an ngaih pawimawh hle laiin Mizoramah ramngaw dur, ngaw chhah ṭha a tam tawh lo hle tih sawiin, ramngaw humhalhna kawngah ṭan lak a ṭul thu a sawi a. Kangmei tihchhuah chu ramngaw tihchereuna lian ber a nih avangin kangmei ven a pawimawhzia sawiin, kangmei vanga chhiatna tam tak chu fimkhurnaa pumpelh theih a nih thu a sawi a. Ramngaw chu nungchate chenna hmun, boruak thianghlim leh tui thianghlim min petu a nih bakah, sawrkar laipuiin state tinte pawisa dawn tur zat (10%) tehfung atan an ramngaw neih ṭhat dan a chhut tel avangin thing leh mauvin sum a hlawh chhuak tih hriat a, ramngawte chu kangmei leh a chereu theihna dang laka ven him a pawimawh thu a sawi a. Kangmei chhuak chuan ramngaw a tihchhiat bakah, a tikangtute chu thubuai siamsak ṭhin an nih thu sawiin, buaina leh harsatna pumpelh turin kangmei laka fimkhur tlan a pawimawh thu a sawi a. Kal khawmte chu kangmei ven pawimawhna zau zawka inzirtir leh puanzar kawnga ṭan la tur leh dan bawhchhia an awm chuan thuneitute hnena thlen vat ṭhin turin a sawm.

"Nungchate chenna leh tui thianghlim min petu ramngaw kangmei lakah veng him rawh" tih thupui hmanga February ni 9 — 13, 2026 chhunga Kangmei Ven Chawlhkar hman tur hawnna hun hi Lunglei Election Officer Pi Lalhruaitluangi chuan kaihruaiin, inlawmna thu a sawi a. Chairman kaihhruaiin mipui kal khawmte chuan kangmei tichhuak lo tura intiamna an chham rual a. DLCFP Member Secretary, Environment, Forests & Climate Change (EF&CC) Lunglei Divisional Forest Officer Pi Lawmnapari chuan kum hmasa lama Lunglei District-a kangmei venna kawnga hma lak dan tlangpui tar langin, Lunglei District Village Council Association President Pu V. Lawmkima hnen aṭangin thu sawi ngaihthlak a ni bawk.

He hunah hian sawrkar official-te, village/local council leh tlawmngai pawl ai awhte, MJA leh zirlaite an kal khawm a. Power & Electricity (P&E) Lunglei Power Maintenance Division-I aṭangin Junior Engineer Pu Lalawmpuia leh Fire & Emergency Service, Lunglei aṭangin Station Officer Pu T. Lalchhandama te'n PowerPoint presentation hmangin kangmei laka fimkhurna tur hrang hrang an sawi a. Kangmei chhuah thulhah state fire emergency number 112 bakah, Lunglei Fire & Emergency Service landline number — 0372-2325366 emaw, 0372-2324101 emaw, mobile number 8794889383 emaw kal tlangin biak pawh theih an nih thu tar lan niin, kangmei chhuah thu report-tute'n kangṭhelh motor tana kalkawng awlsam ber te, kangmei chhuah chhan leh eng nge kang tih te leh thil pawimawh tur te sawi tel nachang hriat a pawimawh thu tar lan a ni bawk.

Kumina Kangmei Ven Chawlhkar hman chhung hian Lunglei District chhungah kangmei venna lam inzirtirna (awareness campaign) uar zawka kalpui turin VC/LC leh tlawmngai pawlte nen thawk hovin department lamin hma an la dawn a. Media kal tlanga sawi hona, thuchah leh inzirtirna hrang hrang tihchhuah te, kohhran inkhawma thu puantir te, vantlang tlangau hmanga inzirtirna puan leh intihsiakna hrang hrang buatsaih te tum a ni a. Kangmei ven kawnga thawk ṭha khuate chawimawina 'Village Level Fire Prevention Award 2026' pawh siam leh tum a ni.

Fire Prevention Week hi Mizoramah kum 2000 aṭang khan hman ṭan niin, kumin hi a ṭum 27-na a ni a. Kum 2009 aṭang khan district leh village level fire prevention award sem ṭan niin, kumin pawh hian award hi sem leh tum a ni.

DLCFP Member Secretary report-a a lan danin, nikum khan Lunglei District chuan Mizoram district hrang hrang zinga kangmei veng ṭha ber, District Level Fire Prevention Award 2025 lawmman pakhatna lain, Lunglei District chhunga Village Level Fire Prevention Award 2025-ah pakhatna Lungsen-I, pahnihna Mualcheng South leh pathumna Mualṭhuam North an ni a. Kum 2025 chhung khan VC/LC leh YMA te nen ṭang tlangin ram kang/kangmei ven chungchang inzirtirna kalpui ṭhin niin, sawrkar pisa hrang hrangah kangmei veng tur leh fimkhur tura intiamna sawi rual a ni a; hmun pawimawh leh langsar laiah te inzirtirna thuziak tar niin, kohhran hun hmannaah thu chhiar chhuah tur te pek a ni a. Print/electronic/social media kal tlang te'n inzirtirna hrang hrang theh darh a ni bawk a. Lunglei District-a kangmei tichhuaktu mi 33 lakah court-ah thubuai ziah luh niin, dan angin an chungah hma lak a ni bawk.

title: Serchhip DC-in Kangmei Laka Kan Him leh Inven Nana Ngenna Tichhuak
content:
4355/2025-2026

Dated Serchhip, the 9 th February, 2026:Khua a lo thal leh ta a, mipuite kangmei laka kan fimkhur tlan theuh nan Deputy Commissioner, Serchhip District chuan mipuite hnenah ngenna leh hriattirna a hnuaia mi ang hian a tichhuak.

1. Serchhip District mipuiten zawm theuh tura ngen leh hriattir kan ni e.

2. In chhuahsan leh zan mut hmain kangmei tichhuak mai thei thil a awm leh awm loh enfiah hmasak zel tur a ni.

3. Ei rawngbawlna Gas (LPG) fimkhur takin hmang la, a leak a nih chuan hmang lui suh. Tin, gas hman loh laiin regulator-ah OFF thin hian a tihim lehzual.4. Parda, thosilen leh puanzar bul hnaiah mombati leh bati ang chi reng reng chhit loh tur a ni.

5. Kangmei tichhuak thei petrol, khawnvartui leh diesel fimkhur takin hmang la, mei bul hnaiah dah loh tur a ni. A dahna chhin phui that tur a ni.

6. Mei nung reng reng ngaihthah loh tur, meizial bung paih fimkhur la (a bik takin ram kal naah), a nung chungin paih suh.

7. Meichhemna hmanrua: nawalh leh lighter-te naupang khawih phakah dah miah loh tur a ni.

8. In leh a velah kangmei tichhuak thei an awm leh awm loh enfel thin la. Veng hmawr deuhva awm i nih chuan ram kang laka i him nan i in bul zau tak thianfai thin ang che.

9. Kangmei a lo chhuahin chi-ai mai loh tur a ni a, rang takin inchhunga mite leh thenawm hnaite hrilh vat la, Fire Station hnai berah fiah tak leh rang takin kangmei chhuahna hmun hriattir ang che. Fire Station biak pawhna: 8119884154 leh SerchhipPolice Station: 9233092581 ah te hriattir vat thin tur a ni.

10. Kangmei chhuah thulhah kangthelhna hmanrua nena i lo inralrin lawk hi kan himna a nih avangin kangthelhna hmanrua neih theuh i tum ang u.

11. Lo hal a lo hun leh ta a, sawrkar-in a lo hal hun chung atan a ruat March ni 15, 2026 ral hma ngeiin hal ila. Lo hal tur ten mei kawng tha tak sial ngei ngei tur a ni.

Hei hi Village Council ten lo bengkhawnin, thuawihlo/a hun loa halte chu report-in, dan hnuaia hremna chelek ngei tur a ni.

title: Champhaiah mock drill neih a ni

Champhai, dated 9th February 2026:Vawiin khan National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) kaihhruaina hnuaia Multi State Mock Exercise chu Champhai District-ah Kolasib leh Mamit District rualin neih a ni.

Mock drill hi lirnghing thlen thulha chetlak dan inzirna leh enchhinna niin lirnghing hi North East India-a thleng anga ngaih a ni a, Champhai District-ah pawh na taka thleng anga ngaih a ni. Chawhma dar 10:30-ah a thlen rualin siren a ri nghal a, District Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) kaihhruaina hnuaiah Circuit House-ah District Emergency Operation Centre (DEOC) din nghal a ni a. Hmun pali - CHANEM Building, District Hospital, District Education Office leh Vengsang Residential Area-ah chhiatna a thleng a, Champhai Bawrhsap leh Responsible Officer ni bawk Pu Mohammad Aaquib chuan DEOC kaihruaiin ro an rel nghal a. Incident commander te, liaison officer te, staging area manager te, logistics section chief te ruat an ni a, MRP te, Assam Rifles te, BRTF te leh Fire & Emergency Services atang tein Search & Rescue Team (SAR) team din an ni a, hmun tinah thawnchhuah nghal an ni. Heng chhiatna hmunah hian chhanchhuah hna te, meialh tih mit te, ruang leh hliam tuar sawngbawl leh enkawl te leh thil tul dang te rang taka kalpui nghal a ni a, damdawi ina enkawl ngai te pawh hruai nghal an ni. Hmun tinah hian observer ruat an ni bawk a, observer te hian heng chetlak dan hrang hranga tha lai leh tha lo lai te an thlithlai a, report an ziak nghal bawk a ni. He mock drill pumpui thlithlai tur hian CISF Asst. Commandant Pu GK Pathak a lo tel bawk a ni.

Mock drill zawh hian DEOC-ah debriefing neih a ni a, state level-a thlithlaitu leh district dang nen mock drill chungchang sawiho a ni bawk.

title: KOLASIBAH LIRNGHING THLEN THULHA CHET LAK DAN TUR MOCK DRILL NEIH A NI
content:
4353/2025-2026

Kolasib, 9th February, 2026:Vawiin khan Kolasib khawpui chhung hmun hrang hrangah lirnghing a thlen thulha chet lak dan tur enchhinna (Mock Drill) neih a ni a. He hunah hian National Highway-a leimin thleng thei te, relief camp, sawrkar office, bazar leh residential area-a chhiatrupna thleng thei te a tak anga chan a ni.

Mock Drill hi zing dar 9:30-ah tan niin, chhiatrupna thlenna hmuna chet la tur chhanchhuah hna thawktu (Rescue Operation Team) te chu DC Complex kawtzawlah inhmukhawmin, heta tang hian an duty-na hmun tur theuh an pan a ni.

Chhanchhuah hna thawh a nih lai hian DC Conference Hall-ah Brig. Ravinder Gurung, Sr. Consultant, National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) hovin Incidence Response Team te chuan Video Conference hmangin Mock Drill neihna hmun hrang hrangte an vil a. Brig. Gurung hian Kolasib District bakah Mamit leh Champhai District-a Mock Drill neih mekte pawh a vil tel nghal bawk a ni.

Brig. Ravinder Gurung chuan DC Conference Hall-a debriefing neihna ah thu sawiin, chhiatrupna thlen thulha inbuatsaihna pawimawh zia a tarlang a. Department hrang hrangte chu chhiatrupna a thlen thulha hma an lak dan tur 'Disaster Plan' mumal tak nei theuh turin a chah a ni.

A bik takin Public Health Engineering (PHE) Department chu Disaster Plan fel tak nei tura chahin, tui dahkhawlna (Reserve Reservoir) an neih a pawimawh thu a sawi a, "Mipuiten chhiatrupna an tawh hunah eitur aiin tui an mamawh hmasa zawk thin a ni," a ti. Hemi bakah hian Power & Electricity (P&E), Transport, Public Works Department (PWD), Hospital leh Internet Service Provider-te pawh chhiatrupna a thlen thulha plan mumal tak nei turin a chah bawk. Inbiakpawhna tha communication chu a pawimawh zia tarlangin, heng chhanchhuah hna te hi communication tha a awm chuan a tam zawk hi kan sukiang thei a ni, a ti bawk.

Vawiina Kolasib-a Mock Drill neihnaah hian lirnghing a thlen thulha chet lak dan tur hrang hrang te, in leh lo chim kara tangte chhanchhuah dan te leh hliam tuar buaipui dan te a tak angin entir a ni a. He hunah hian National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), KolasibPolice, State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) Mualvum, Fire & Emergency Services, Medical Team leh Quick Response Team (QRT) te bakah, school naupangte, sawrkar hnathawkte leh volunteer ruat bikte an tel a ni.

title: CHIEF MINISTER ATTENDS INAUGURATION OF NEW SAIRANG–SILCHAR RAIL SERVICE
content:
502/2025-2026

Aizawl, 9 February 2026:The Hon’ble Union Minister for Railways, Shri Ashwini Vaishnaw, today virtually inaugurated the new rail service between Sairang and Silchar from Guwahati, along with the Blended Hospitality Service at Guwahati Railway Station. To mark the occasion, a special programme was organised at Sairang Railway Station, which was attended by the Hon’ble Chief Minister of Mizoram, Pu Lalduhoma. Prof. Lalnilawma, Minister; Pu B. Lalchhanzova, Minister; and Pu TBC Lalvenchhunga, Adviser to the Chief Minister and local MLA, were also present.

Addressing the gathering, the Chief Minister stated that under the leadership of the Hon’ble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi, the Act East Policy has elevated Mizoram and the North Eastern region to an increasingly important position in the nation’s development trajectory. He observed that regions once perceived as remote are now benefiting from enhanced connectivity, with the newly inaugurated Sairang–Silchar rail service standing as a significant milestone in this progress.

The Chief Minister noted that the new rail link would further strengthen connectivity with Assam, facilitate broader market access for Mizoram’s agricultural produce such as ginger and other crops, and reinforce the State’s flagship Bana Kaih scheme. He expressed his gratitude to the Union Railway Minister for acceding to his request to operationalise the Sairang–Silchar rail service.

Highlighting the strategic importance of Silchar, the Chief Minister described it as not merely a neighbouring city but a vital economic gateway for Mizoram, adding that the new service would contribute positively to the State’s economic growth.

He also recalled that Sairang Railway Station, inaugurated five months ago, has already witnessed substantial developmental activities within a short span. Commending the efforts of the Railways Ministry, particularly the NF Railway Lumding Division, he acknowledged their role in advancing rail infrastructure in the region.

The Chief Minister further underscored the need to construct a warehouse facility at Sairang Railway Station to support Handholding Scheme and local entrepreneurs, and to finalize the rail line to Thenzawl Peace City. He also advocated for the extension of the Delhi–Silchar Rajdhani Express up to Sairang.

Following the inauguration programme, the Chief Minister reviewed the design for upgrading Sairang Railway Station into a World Class Railway Station. Railway officials informed him that Rs.  ₹97 crore have been sanctioned, tenders have been issued, and the opening of tenders is expected in March.

Kumin atanaKangmei Ven Haptathupui chu‘Nungcha tinreng chenna leh tui thianghlim min petu ramngawte, kangmei lakah venghim rawh’tih niin vawiin vek hian District hrang hrangah pawhKangmei Ven Haptahi hman tan a ni bawk.

EF&CC Minister chuan thu sawiin 'Kangmei Ven Hapta 2026'chu mipuite’n kangmei laka fimkhur nachang kan hriat thar leh theuhna tur atan te, uar lehzuala invenna kalpui a nih theih nan tea hmalakna a nih thu a sawi a. ‘Record-a tarlan a nih danin Mizoram chu engtiklai pawha ram kang/kangmei chhuah thut theihna hmun a nih avangin kumtluana kangmei laka fimkhur nachang kan hriat reng a ngai a ni’ a ti a. Kangmei laka ramngawte veng him tur leh sik leh sa inthlak danglam nasa lutuk tur veng turin mipuite’n inzirtirna kan neih nasat a ngaih thu sawiin, khawpuia chengte chu hma la hmasatuah tang se a duh thu a sawi a. Sawrkar pawhin media hrang hrang kaltlanga uar lehzuala hmalak zel a tum thu sawiin, kangmei venna kawnga thawk tha khuate hnenah pawh lawmman siam a nih leh tur thu a sawi bawk.

YMA leh Environmental NGO hrang hrangten ramngaw ven him kawnga an thawhpuinaah lawmthu sawiin, hun lo awm leh zel turah pawh thawh hona tha tak neihpuiah a sawm nghal a; ramngaw ti chereu tam lo tura lo neih dan kalphung tha lehzual a awm theih nan te, hmasawnna hna thawh leh environment humhalhte pawh inkhuangrual taka kalpui a nih theih nan, Forest Department chu Prohibitory ni lova Regulatory an nih thute sawiin, Department hrang hrangte nen pawh thawh hona tha tak neih zel a pawimawh thu a sawi a. ‘Ram mipui zawng zawngte’n, he kan chenna ram humhim tur hian tangruala kan thawh ho a ngai takzet a ni’ a ti bawk.

VawiinKangmei Ven Haptahawnna inkhawmah hian Ravi Horo, Additional Principal Chief Conservator of Forests (Planning) chuan kalkhawmte lawmna thu a sawi a; Principal Chief Conservator of Forests Rajeev Kumar Tiwari-an Fire Prevention Week thil tum tlangpuite a sawi bawk a; Pollution Control Board Chairman Pu Liankima Lailung kaihruaiin nungcha leh ramngaw humhalh tura thutiam lakna neih ni bawkin Department hrang hrang aiawhte bakah Environmental NGO leh YMA hruaitute he hunah hian an tel a; Lalnunsanga Khawlhring, DFO, Aizawl chuan lawmthu sawiin hun hi a khar a ni.

Kangmei Ven Hapta 2026 hi February ni 9 atanga ni 13 thleng neih tura ruahman a ni a, kangmei venna kawnga hma la thazual khaw pathumte hnenah lawmman pek an ni ang a, khaw dang ti tha pathumte hnenah consolation prize pek an ni bawk ang. Huan emaw, leipui emaw tur atana mimal ram vatte chuan March ni 5 ral hmain an hal tur a ni a, khawtlang theh ram neitute chuan March ni 15 ral hmain an lote chu an hal tur a ni. title: 'FIRE PREVENTION WEEK 2026’ LAUNCHED IN LAWNGTLAI
content:
501/2025-2026

Lawngtlai, 9 February 2026:Fire Prevention Week 2026 was formally launched today at the DC Conference Hall, Lawngtlai, under the initiative of the Lawngtlai District Level Committee on Fire Prevention. The programme was inaugurated by Dr. Lorrain Lalpekliana Chinzah, Adviser to the Chief Minister and MLA of Lawngtlai East, who attended as the Chief Guest. The programme was chaired by Lawngtlai Deputy Commissioner Shri Donny Lalruatsanga.

In his inaugural address, Dr. Lorrain Lalpekliana Chinzah emphasised the importance of observing Fire Prevention Week to ensure the safety of Lawngtlai District from forest fires. He stated that the Government is making continuous efforts to control forest fires in Mizoram, which cause widespread damage every year, and has even instituted incentives to encourage villages to actively participate in forest fire prevention.He noted that forest fires are more frequent during the dry season and stressed the need for extra caution, especially by farmers and jhum cultivators, urging them to strictly follow safe fire practices.

The MLA highlighted that forest fires cause severe damage to valuable natural resources such as trees, bamboo, wildlife, and water sources, and said it is now a crucial time for people to act responsibly to prevent further environmental degradation.

The Chief Guest urged Village Level Fire Prevention Committees to work with full dedication, particularly in enforcing guidelines and creating awareness among the public. He also called upon Government departments, NGOs, Village Councils, media persons, and Churches to actively contribute to forest fire prevention efforts.

Adviser to Chief Minister further stated that preventing forest fires cannot be left to others alone and that every individual has a responsibility. While Lawngtlai District has received awards in the past for forest fire prevention, he observed that there is still significant scope for improvement and encouraged all stakeholders to work collectively to secure the top position this year. Emphasising that unity is strength, he appealed to the people of Lawngtlai District to work together to prevent forest fires and protect forests for a greener and healthier environment.

Deputy Commissioner Shri Donny Lalruatsanga, in his address, welcomed the participants and reminded everyone that preventing forest fires is a shared responsibility. He appealed to the people of Lawngtlai District to remain vigilant and cautious to avoid forest fires. Shri K. Lalromawia, Member Secretary of the Lawngtlai District Level Committee on Fire Prevention and District Council Conservator of Forests, presented the district report and led the pledge-taking ceremony. Shri B. Lalrinmuanpuia, ACF, LADC, conducted a Sensitisation and Awareness Campaign through a PowerPoint presentation.

Fire Prevention Week has been observed annually since 2000, each year with a specific theme. The theme for 2026 is “Protect forests from fire – they shelter life and provide us clean water.” The week-long programme will be observed from 9 to 13 February 2026.

The programme was attended by officials from the Mizoram Government and LADC, representatives of Village Councils, NGOs, the Mizoram Journalists’ Association (MJA), and Church leaders. Shri  M.S. Dawngliana, General Secretary of the Lawngtlai District Village Council Association, delivered the vote of thanks and formally concluded the programme.
